com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence.Position

  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Position.java A class that contains x and y coordinates for a position in a 2-dim matrix
    Author:
    Anna Osterlund, id10aod

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Position(int x, int y)
      Constructor that is used when a Position is initiated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int distanceTo(Position position)
      distanceTo calculates the Manhattan/taxi cab distance between two positions.
      boolean equals(Position position)
      equals checks if this position has the same xy-coorinates as a given position

      getPosToEast provides the neighbour position east of this position

      • distanceTo

        public int distanceTo(Position position)
        distanceTo calculates the Manhattan/taxi cab distance between two positions. Manhattan distance isthe sum of the absolute value of the distance along the x-axis and the absolute value of the distance along the y-axis.
        Parameters:
        position - - the position to mesure the distance to.
        Returns:
        the distance to the position

      • getPosToNorth

        public Position getPosToNorth()
        getPosToNorth provides the neighbour position north of this position
        Returns:
        - Position to north

      • getPosToSouth

        public Position getPosToSouth()
        getPosToSouth provides the neighbour position south of this position
        Returns:

      • getPosToWest

        public Position getPosToWest()
        getPosToWest provides the neighbour position west of this position
        Returns:
        - Position to west

      • getPosToEast

        public Position getPosToEast()
        getPosToEast provides the neighbour position east of this position
        Returns:
        - Position to east

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Position position)
        equals checks if this position has the same xy-coorinates as a given position
        Parameters:
        position - - the position to compare with this position
        Returns:
        true if the positions has the same xy-coordinates, false if not
